alert.note: Alert for Clay; Fentress; Jackson; Macon; Overton; Pickett; Sumner (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 20 at 5:57AM CDT until July 20 at 12:00PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Middle Tennessee, including the following counties, Clay, Fentress, Jackson, Macon, Overton, Pickett and Sumner. * WHEN...Until 900 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 556 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms tracking towards the southeast. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lafayette, Livingston, Celina, Gainesboro, Byrdstown, Westmoreland, Red Boiling Springs, Moss, Whitleyville, Standing Stone State Park and Dale Hollow Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Clay; Fentress; Jackson; Macon; Overton; Pickett; Sumner
